outputs.output_descr: Conflict prevention and post-conflict recovery activities aim to build trust, social cohesion, social co-existence and mutual support. This social capital is essential for reconciliation and consolidating peace, and embodies the ideals at the core of volunteerism. UNV focusses its efforts on community-based, conflict-sensitive development initiatives and local capacity development for peace building and conflict management. UNV has significant experience in disaster prevention and risk reduction. The Hyogo Framework for Action explicitly recognized the added value and contribution of volunteerism to disaster risk management, particularly by bolstering communities' capacities to respond to and prevent disasters. In recovery, including livelihoods, UNV fosters self-sustaining, nationally-owned and resilient processes to enable communities to rebuild better infrastructure and governance systems. In this area, UNV helps build national and local capacity for better coordination and management of recovery programmes.

project_descr: Fully funded UN Volunteer support to UNV Programme Priority Area 4 (PPA 4) on "Crisis Prevention and Recovery"
